instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVRTC_G3_OUT: What is PPVRTC_G3_OUT? PPVRTC_G3_OUT is a 3.3v power line that comes out of the clock chip. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light blinking
threads.message:
no water damage, runs fine off of batt

when you plug in AC the green light blinks on super quick every like 2 seconds

<RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR> was reading like 2.3k so I replaced but still reading same

any ideas before i take board out to check <RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR> or replace ISL

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light blinking
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light blinking
threads.message: replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> and now everything seems fine charging, except it turns on every time you plug the cord in

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light blinking
threads.message: That is normal when either the battery is disconnected or it was not shut down from inside OSX. Did you do a PRAM reset too?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light blinking
threads.message:
yeah i know that behavior but this is different
it does it even when in sleep
if i disconnect or connect the cord it wakes up and stays on

never seen that before, what part of the circuit would cause that?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light blinking
threads.message: Does it power up from battery only? Did you do a PRAM reset?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light blinking
threads.message: yes runs and charges battery fine, pram reset had no effect

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light blinking
threads.message:
I have no idea really. If you shut it down from OSX does it power on again after you connect power? Make sure the option "restart after power failure" is not enabled in OSX. Not sure if this is supported on MacBooks though, it is on desktop machines.
It could be that there is an issue with the RTC power supply. Check if it is present when only battery connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light blinking
threads.message:
yeah whenever you plug in cord or unplug cord computer acts as if power button has been pressed. whether asleep or off.

check <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3_OUT</SIGNAL> ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light blinking
threads.message: If RTC is an issue the time and date would also be reset/wrong after AC power was removed for a few minutes. I really have no idea besides that.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light blinking
threads.message: so very  weird, i left it alone last 4 days in sleep while i was out of town and now it seems to be fine. i didn't even do a pram reset.
